definition: to offer (goods or services)/to open (for business etc)

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display

sentences.english: Mannings opened a brand new flagship store in the Elements Mall of Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 万宁在香港“圆方”商场开设全新形象店。

sentences.english: Twenty laundries were burned that night.
sentences.chinese: 当天晚上，华人开设的洗衣店就有二十家被付之一炬。

sentences.english: China Southern Airlines opened several check in counters.
sentences.chinese: 中国南方航空公司在这里开设了几个值机台。

sentences.english: We acquaint you that we have established ourselves as general agents under the title of Chambers Co.
sentences.chinese: 我们将以钱伯斯公司为名，开设总代销店，特此奉告。

sentences.english: But Jenny has her heart set on attending one of the new college programs for students with intellectual disabilities.
sentences.chinese: 但珍妮一心想进为智障学生新开设的大学班。

sentences.english: Guggenheim Museum and the Pompidou Center in Paris are considering opening branches in China.
sentences.chinese: 和巴黎蓬皮杜艺术中心正考虑在中国开设分支机构。

sentences.english: It's a free government service for all unemployed people.
sentences.chinese: 那是为所有无业人员开设的免费政府机构。

sentences.english: I might have taken French last semester if I'd known it was offered.
sentences.chinese: 如果知道了上个学期开设了法语课的话我会选学的。

sentences.english: A course which has applied to offer multiple classes is not allowed to increase its max capacity.
sentences.chinese: 已申请开设多班之课程，不可再提高人数上限。

sentences.english: The school offers a course on salesmanship .
sentences.chinese: 这学校开设推销技术课程。

sentences.english: It has also been boosted by new Asian stores and weak sterling.
sentences.chinese: 新开设的亚洲专卖店和疲软的英镑也助推了它的增长。

sentences.english: One was to start a hospital for women and children.
sentences.chinese: 其中之一就是开设一家专门接待妇女儿童的医院。

sentences.english: At present, a number of Secondary Healthy Schools have set up the rehabilitation department.
sentences.chinese: 目前，已有不少中等卫校开设了康复专业。

sentences.english: Opening the cafè would clearly attract more customers.
sentences.chinese: 开设咖啡厅显然能吸引更多的顾客。

sentences.english: As part of the anti-obesity campaign, the government also started a healthy eating Web site.
sentences.chinese: 政府也开设了健康饮食的网站，做为反肥胖活动之一。

sentences.english: Finally, courses in the education of accounting integrity should be offered.
sentences.chinese: 最后，开设会计诚信教育的相关课程。

definition: to open/to start (a business etc)/to set up
to add to existing facilities or services
to launch/to develop/to unfold/(of an exhibition etc) to open
to establish/to set up/to be tenable/to hold water
to set up separately/to establish separate units
to engage in (business etc)/to run/to operate
